name: Srcbook
headline: Build and publish web applications in minutes. No coding required.
description:
What if you could build web apps as easily as you make a Figma design or edit a Google Doc?

Enter Srcbook. We've reimagined app development with a state-of-the-art coding agent that builds for our users.

Want to launch that app idea? Need to build something for your community? Looking to prototype faster? Start here. We've removed the barriers between idea and execution.

Our mission is to empower everyone to build for the web, our vision is personal software.

founders.name: Nicholas Charriere, Founder
founders.description:
Currently building Srcbook: an AI app builder

French & British, been a developer in the valley for 12 years in smaller & larger startups (Pinterest, Cruise).
Generalist but most of my recent experience is in distributed systems / AI platforms, I am curious and optimistic.

https://nicholascharriere.com

founders.name: Ben Reinhart, Founder
founders.description: Software engineer and entrepreneur. Previously ML infra at Cruise, cofounder at Fam (acquihired by Nextdoor), and Groupon.

generated_description:
**Srcbook: Easy App Development for Everyone**

Founded in 2023 and born out of Y Combinator’s Batch S23, Srcbook is shaking up the app development game, making it accessible to anyone without a coding background. Imagine being able to create a web application as effortlessly as you would design a mockup in Figma or compose a Google Doc. That’s the vision behind Srcbook.

**Mission and Vision**

At its core, Srcbook aims to empower individuals to build robust web applications with minimal effort and zero coding skills. Their mission is straightforward: help users turn ideas into functioning applications in mere minutes—removing traditional barriers to entry in software development. The company's vision extends further into the future with the concept of "personal software," where everyone can create bespoke applications tailored to their unique needs.

**How It Works**

With Srcbook’s cutting-edge coding agent, users can think up their app ideas—be it a Spotify clone, a weather dashboard, or a chat interface—and see them come to life instantly. This simplified development process caters to those who want to launch their projects quickly, whether for business, community needs, or personal experimentation.

**Location and Team**

Based in the vibrant tech hub of San Francisco, Srcbook operates with a lean team of just two employees, showcasing agility and efficiency—traits that resonate with their user-centric approach. The company is led by Diana Hu, their Group Partner, who brings valuable insights and direction.

**Engagement and Resources**

For those interested in exploring what Srcbook has to offer, the company provides various resources:

- [Manifesto](https://srcbook.com/manifesto): Learn about the ethos behind Srcbook.
- [Pricing](https://srcbook.com/pricing): Understand the cost of utilizing their platform.
- Connect with Srcbook on [GitHub](https://github.com/srcbookdev), [Twitter](https://x.com/srcbookcom), [Discord](https://discord.gg/shDEGBSe2d), and [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@srcbook) for the latest updates and community engagement.

In a world where the ability to build and innovate defines success, Srcbook stands out by democratizing web development. With their clear mission and innovative approach, they’re well-positioned to make a significant impact in the tech landscape. If you’ve got an idea, let Srcbook help you bring it to fruition—because building your app should be as simple as thinking it.
